intro: Listrostachys lecomtei, commonly known as the Lecomte's listrostachys, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
